meanings.sent1: She procured a rare book from the library after searching for weeks.
meanings.sent2: He procured a new bicycle by saving up his allowance.
meanings.sent3: The detective procured the crucial evidence just in time to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: She procured the last ticket to the concert, feeling victorious.
meanings.sent5: The explorer procured fresh water from a hidden spring in the desert.

meanings.definition: Obtain (a person or animal) as a sexual partner for someone.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, parents would procure spouses for their children.
meanings.sent2: The matchmaker procured a suitable companion for the lonely widower.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous friend tried to procure a date for his shy buddy.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox procured a mate by impressing her with his hunting skills.
meanings.sent5: The fairy godmother procured a charming prince for Cinderella.

meanings.definition: Obtain (a commodity or service) through particular means.
meanings.sent1: She procured a discount on the dress by using a coupon.
meanings.sent2: The company procured new software to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The magician procured a rabbit from his hat to amaze the audience.
meanings.sent4: The chef procured fresh ingredients from the local market.
meanings.sent5: The team procured victory through hard work and dedication.
